column2:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score 2)
column3:
Title: Summary comparison - accuracy policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary accurately represents the information provided in the reference text.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary accurately represents the information provided in the reference text.

A slightly better than B in accurately representing the information (Score: -1)

B significantly better than A in accurately representing the information (Score: 2)

Note: The focus is on the accuracy of the representation of information in the summaries, rather than subjective preferences or additional information not present in the reference text.
